title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Manufacturing talent shortage: $1T impact by 2030
items.summary: - The KNOLSKAPE report warns a *global manufacturing talent shortage* could cost **$1 trillion** by 2030, with up to 2.4 million roles unfilled by 2028 as automation grows.\n- It highlights a shift from degrees to skills (94% prioritise *technical expertise* like CNC, automation and data analytics; 85% expect *AI* impact; 71.4% emphasise *human-centric design*).\n- Barriers include budget, ROI challenges, and integration, with *middle managers* as the key upskill bridge for a more *AI-ready*, adaptable workforce.

items.title: Garuda Aerospace aids Indian Army flood relief in J&K & HP
items.summary:
- **Garuda Aerospace** supplied more than 10 drones to the Indian Army for flood-relief operations in Jammu and Kashmir and Himachal Pradesh, delivering over 300 kg of essentials. 
- Drones carried out aerial surveys and relief coordination, with two drones in Kullu (HP) delivering materials despite difficult terrain and ten drones in Kathua (J&K) serving Chilla village. 
- The company has previously aided disasters including floods in Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh and Chennai, locust control in Rajasthan, and COVID-19 emergency deliveries, and its drones have assisted ISRO and NDRF.

items.title: India to boost auto steel with specialised grades
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- **India aims to build a globally competitive steel ecosystem with specialised steels for the auto sector, stressing self‑reliance as a growth driver.**
- The government’s **PLI** scheme worth ₹18,000 crore is catalysing domestic production and attracting projects worth ₹24.8 lakh crore, boosting jobs and reducing imports.
- **Long-term, India becomes a net exporter of auto-grade special steels, aligning with decarbonisation and global mobility leadership.**

items.title: Govt to position India as shipbuilding hub: MoS Thakur
items.summary: - The Government, via the Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways, aims to position India as a new shipbuilding hub to grow its *blue economy*, create jobs, and boost global *competitiveness*.\n- It targets India's maritime share to reach the top 10 by 2030 and top 5 by 2047, supported by *green shipping initiatives* and modernised infrastructure.\n- Policy measures such as the *Maritime Development Fund*, the *Shipbuilding Finance Assistance Policy 2.0* till 2036, incentives for *green fuel vessels*, and shipyard clusters are expected to unlock investments and create jobs.

items.title: India eyes 5-7 nm chips as Semicon 2.0 advances
items.summary:
- *India* aims to leap from 28nm fabs to **5-7nm** chips, accelerating the semiconductor mission through policy support and investments.
- The push includes expanding ATMP/fab capacity, OSAT pilots, and a robust **Semicon 2.0** framework to boost AI chip design in India.
- Since 2021 ISM launch, the government has committed about Rs 65,000 crore under the PLI scheme and approved 10 chip manufacturing projects across several states.

items.title: Plan to build 275k chip designers by 2032
items.author: ET Bureau, Yogima Seth Sharma, Suraksha P
items.summary:
- India aims to build a pool of *275,000 chip designers* and grow its semiconductor workforce to *1.2 million* by 2032, positioning the country as a global hub for *semiconductor innovation*. 
- A cross‑ministry roadmap will redesign *curriculums*, establish *training institutes*, and pursue a specialised *VLSI* degree to close the talent gap across the value chain. 
- Coordinated policies across MeitY, Education and Skills Development aim to expand *STEM* education, fund scholarships, and train 100,000 technicians to build a future‑ready workforce.

items.title: 25% in 2025! Local iPhone dispatch seen zooming
items.author: Subhrojit Mallick, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The *Indian* iPhone dispatches are seen up **25%** in 2025 to about 14–15 million, aided by discounts on older models and the iPhone 17 rollout.
- IDC and Canalys expect about **15 million** and **14.2 million** units, with wholesale revenues rising toward **$12.3B** as upgrades and ecosystem sales accelerate.
- Apple plans to boost upgrades and attach rates via flagship stores in Mumbai, Delhi, Bengaluru and Pune, with the iPhone 17 starting at ₹82,900.

items.title: India’s clean energy shift: demand, storage & hydrogen
items.summary:
- India’s electricity demand is set to reach *708 GW* by 2047, requiring ~2,100 GW of installed capacity to align with **net-zero by 2070**.
- Solar and wind lead growth with a **500 GW renewables target** for 2030 (280 GW solar, 140 GW wind) and solar’s ~5,000 bn units/year potential.
- Storage, **green hydrogen**, and EVs drive the transition: ~74 GW storage by 2031–32, 60% lower battery costs by 2030, and a $2.4B subsidy push toward 5 MMT hydrogen by 2030 with expanding EV charging.

items.title: Eastern India renewables at 20% vs 48% avg: IREDA CMD
items.summary:
- *Eastern India* accounts for only *20%* of installed renewables, far below the national *48%* average, per IREDA CMD Pradip Kumar Das.
- He urged tapping *solar*, *pumped storage*, *battery storage* and *green hydrogen*, and mobilising about ₹30 lakh crore to reach 500 GW non-fossil capacity by 2030, with the East as a growth hub.
- IREDA has disbursed over ₹1.63 lakh crore in 38 years, emphasising governance, a *green taxonomy*, and stronger *ESG* to back India’s energy transition.

items.title: ACME and IHI advance green ammonia project in Odisha
Researchers claim carbon-negative tech development for green hydrogen production
Servotech subsidiary to acquire Hertz & Pixelz
Hindustan Zinc signs MoU with Rajasthan Heritage Authority
India’s coking coal demand to rise to 135 mn by 2030: Report
items.summary:
- The EY Parthenon–ISA report expects *coking coal demand* to rise from **87 Mt** in FY25 to **135 Mt** by 2030, driven by the steel sector.
- India currently meets about **90%** of its needs via imports, led by Australia, with diversification to Mongolia and Mozambique to mitigate supply risk.
- To cut imports, the government aims to lift domestic raw coal production to **140 Mt by FY30** (66.8 Mt in FY24), expand washed coal to **15 Mt**, and enable 100% FDI in mining.

items.title: ALUMEX India 2025 opens on aluminium extrusion
items.summary:
- ALUMEX India 2025, the country’s first aluminium extrusion expo, opened at Pragati Maidan in New Delhi with 200+ exhibitors and 25,000 visitors.
- India’s extrusion capacity is 3 Mtpa but output is 1.2 Mtpa, with the gap filled by imports from China and ASEAN amid price and FTAs pressures.
- ALEMAI’s Jitendra Chopra calls the event a signal of domestic capability, supporting *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, MSME policy, and local billet access to strengthen the value chain.

items.title: Tata Elxsi & Bayer open radiology centre in Pune
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Tata Elxsi* and **Bayer** inaugurated the Bayer Development Centre in Radiology at Tata Elxsi's Pune facility to jointly develop radiology devices and technology.
- The centre will provide engineering support for complex radiology devices, initially focusing on *molecular imaging*, integrating design, development, and validation to accelerate time‑to‑market while meeting **regulatory compliance** standards.
- The collaboration leverages Tata Elxsi's **AI/ML** and regulatory expertise to deliver radiology solutions to markets including the US and Europe, backed by labs and partnerships in India.

items.title: Tech-policy synergies for India's semiconductor leadership
items.summary:
- India’s semiconductor leadership hinges on the convergence of *tech*, *policy*, and *partnerships*, as Delta Electronics illustrates.
- Delta’s Srivastava points to advanced fabs, secure supply chains, and *Industry 4.0* tools—AI, digital twins, and automation—as keys to scaling domestic manufacturing.
- Robust government drives like the *India Semiconductor Mission* and *Make in India*, plus global collaborations, are essential for a sustainable, self-reliant ecosystem.

items.title: South Korea to mass-produce humanoid robots by 2029
items.summary:
- *South Korea* plans mass production of **humanoid robots** by 2029 and **AI-powered autonomous vehicles** by 2030 to lead the global **AI transformation** in manufacturing.
- The **Manufacturing AX Alliance (M.AX)**, including Hyundai Motor Group, LG Electronics, Samsung Electronics and Posco Group, will build **AI factories** and develop a foundation AI model for humanoids by 2028, aiming for at least **1,000 robots annually** from 2029.
- Government aims to generate over **₩100 trillion** in added value by 2030, construct 500 **AI factories**, and deliver 10 home appliance prototypes with on‑device AI semiconductors, positioning Korea as a leading manufacturing AX nation.

items.title: Indian consumer goods firms brace for Nepal unrest impact
items.author: Ratna Bhushan, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- *Indian consumer goods majors* like **Varun Beverages**, **Dabur**, **ITC**, **Marico** and **HUL** are closely monitoring the impact amid Nepal's unrest. 
- *Varun Beverages’* Nepal operation contributes about **3%** of its consolidated revenue, while **Reliance Consumer Products** launched **Campa** in Nepal with **Chaudhary Group**. 
- Close to a dozen Indian companies have Nepal operations across packaged goods and hospitality, with **Bikaji Foods International** signing a **50:50 JV** with **Chaudhary Group**.

items.title: Serentica to add 6.5 GW by 2027
items.summary:
- Serentica plans to raise operational capacity from 1 GW to **7.5 GW** by 2027, including **3 GW** from government-owned REIAs.
- In the first five months, it signed PPAs/LoA totaling **650 MW**, including **NTPC 200 MW** and **SECI 100 MW**, with NHPC **150 MW** and SJVN **200 MW** across Rajasthan, Maharashtra, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.
- By 2030, it targets **17 GW** of capacity with storage (PSPs and BESS), aiming to supply over **50 billion units/year** and offset about **47 million tonnes** of CO2.

items.title: India turns to Myanmar rebels for rare earths as China tightens control
Japan to plan floating wind test centre next year
items.summary:
- *FLOWRA* chairman Masakatsu Terazaki said Japan will start planning a national floating wind test centre next year, to verify technology in Japanese waters.
- *Mitsubishi*'s withdrawal is a setback, but industry officials say the plan will sustain momentum for offshore wind in Japan.
- *EMEC* and *METCentre* collaborations aim for Japan's first large floating wind project by fiscal 2029 to boost energy security.

items.title: Vikram Solar reports ₹133 cr net profit in Q1
items.summary:
- The *Q1 FY26* net profit jumped to **₹133.4 crore**, up from **₹22.8 crore** a year ago, as revenue rose to **₹1,133 crore** with a **79.7% YoY** gain. 
- The company’s order book stood at **10.96 GW** as of June 30, with EBITDA up **117.3%** to **₹242.2 crore**, and it plans to scale capex by **4x** while backward integrating into **solar cell manufacturing**. 
- *Kolkata-based* Vikram Solar, one of India’s largest **PV module manufacturers** with capacity around **4.5 GW**, recently listed on exchanges after its Aug 26 debut.

items.title: Lupin CFO: Pharma industry braces for US tariffs
items.author: Shivam Tyagi
items.summary: - The Lupin CFO warns that if *US tariffs* on pharma are imposed, *affordability* and access to medicines could be harmed. - He outlines scenarios including reciprocal tariffs or US manufacturing, with costs potentially passed to consumers. - The *UK-India Free Trade Agreement* could unlock broader opportunities while keeping medicines *affordable* and accessible.

items.title: Telangana CM seeks defence land transfer for Gandhi Sarovar
items.summary: - The Telangana CM A. Revanth Reddy met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in New Delhi and sought transfer of 98.20 acres of defence land in Hyderabad for the *Gandhi Sarovar Project*.\n- He outlined plans for a *Gandhi Circle of Unity* at the confluence of the Musi and Esa rivers and proposed components including a knowledge hub, meditation village, handloom centre, a public museum and a statue of peace.\n- Union Minister Nitin Gadkari assured sending an official team to Hyderabad to study the *greenfield road network* linking Bharat Future City to Bandaru Port, with a review on September 22 in Hyderabad.

items.title: United-Spirit clash over business model
items.summary: - United questioned Spirit's survival, calling the *ultra-low-cost* model an *interesting experiment* that has "failed".\n- Spirit fired back on X, praising its *low fares* and premium offerings, and quipping that United executives can't stop talking about them.\n- With Spirit's bankruptcy protections and network reductions, United moved to capture market share by selling tickets to 15 Spirit markets to offer customers options.

items.title: TSMC posts 33.8% YoY August revenue boost
items.summary:
- *TSMC's August 2025 consolidated revenue* reached NT$335.77 billion (US$10.41B), up 3.9% from July and 33.8% from August 2024.
- *January–August 2025 revenue* stood at NT$2.43 trillion (US$75.39B), up 37.1% YoY.
- *H1 2025 subsidies* total USD 2.23B from four governments, lifting total aid to USD 4.7B over 18 months.

items.title: India’s largest PCB facility in Andhra Pradesh
items.author: Samdani MN
items.summary:
- SSEPL will invest **₹1,076 crore** to set up PCB manufacturing and R&D in Naidupeta, creating 1,011 jobs.
- Together with two other Syrma projects—CCL facility (**₹417.78 crore**, 647 jobs) and EMS facility (**₹100 crore**, 510 jobs)—the total investment reaches **₹1,593 crore** and over 2,100 jobs.
- The AP **ECMS policy** provides incentives such as capital subsidies, power incentives, and land at concessional rates to boost electronics manufacturing and cut import dependence.

items.title: India, EU trade pact talks in fast lane: Goyal
items.summary:
- *Piyush Goyal* said talks on the proposed free trade agreement are progressing fast, with about 60–65% of chapters completed and a substantial conclusion possible by the EU commissioners' visit.
- The 13th round is under way in New Delhi as *Maros Sefcovic* and *Christophe Hansen* are expected to visit this week, signaling active convergence.
- He warned the steel sector against rushing to import cheaper material, urging protection of domestic producers and mindful use of *CBAM* to safeguard self-reliance.

items.title: Botanic Healthcare opens liposomal manufacturing facility in Hyderabad
Italian Navy PASSEX with INS Surat
items.summary:
- The *PASSEX* between Italy's Caio Duilio and India’s INS Surat occurred under the EU’s *Operation ASPIDES* in the Indian Ocean.
- It included manoeuvring drills, data exchanges, and simultaneous flight operations to boost *operational interoperability* and *maritime security*.
- The engagement strengthens India–Europe cooperation on freedom of navigation and strategic sea lanes, promoting regional stability.

items.title: Fertiliser ITC hit despite cheaper raw materials
items.author: Shambhavi Anand, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- Subsidy-related price inversion keeps a large accumulation of *GST ITC* despite lower raw material costs.
- Industry urges a full refund of ITC and a clarification under *Section 54(3)* to enable refunds, easing *working capital* and funding capital projects.
- Although GST on fertilisers was cut to 5%, persisting cash-flow pressures threaten the supply chain and investment in the sector.

items.title: Homegrown, high-tech weapons: Army Chief
items.author: Manu Pubby, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- The Army Chief Gen Upendra Dwivedi says *home-grown* weapons built via a triad of industry, academia and the military can counter superior adversaries using *low-cost, high-tech* solutions.
- He envisions extended ranges for loitering munitions to 750 km and rockets to 300 km, stressing rapid tech upgrades under *Aatmanirbhar* self-reliance.
- He cites a projected defence spend of about ₹3 lakh crore with 10% annual growth to spur a cross-domain *Aatmanirbhar* ecosystem delivering cutting-edge solutions.

items.title: Mexico seeks to impose tariffs on auto, manufacturing imports
items.summary:
- Mexico will propose a 2026 budget bill to impose tariffs on autos and some manufacturing imports to address trade imbalances and raise about 70 billion pesos ($3.76B) in state revenue.
- Lerma said the plan would follow international treaty rules, applying to countries without current trade agreements.
- Analysts warn tariffs could lift inflation, noting much of Mexico's industrial input comes from China, while the United States remains its main trading partner.

items.title: Boeing Defense strike enters sixth week with sides still at loggerheads
Tata Electronics builds wall to deter elephants in Assam
items.summary:
- Tata Electronics is building a **massive elephant-proof wall** around its upcoming OSAT plant in *Assam*, with government support to keep **elephants** from disrupting construction.
- The site also faces vibration and wildlife challenges, with rescuers capturing and relocating snakes to their habitat to prevent interference with precision chip assembly.
- The Rs 27,000 crore project, part of the *India Semiconductor Mission*, has potential customers like **Tesla**, signaling a major push for semiconductors in India.

items.title: Arm launches new generation of mobile chip designs geared for AI
DLI 2.0: Govt plans sops, local sourcing mandates to push chip demand
Sophos: AI use drives cybersecurity burnout in India 2025
items.summary:
- Sophos’ 5th APJ report finds *cybersecurity burnout* in India at 95% of organisations in 2025, up from 83% in 2024, driven by increased threat activity, board pressure, and alert overload. 
- AI has a two‑pronged effect: *AI-powered security tools* can relieve fatigue and speed incident response, while widespread **shadow AI** use by employees creates new risks and governance gaps. 
- Burnout is a business issue affecting productivity, incident response, and budgets; 87% offer counselling and 71% plan budget increases, underscoring the need for robust *AI governance* and clear usage boundaries.

items.title: Sterling & Wilson bags ₹415 cr solar order
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- The order is a **300 MW AC/420 MWp** solar PV project in Rajasthan under a **BOS EPC** package, valued at ₹415 crore including *O&M* and taxes.
- SWREL is a global EPC player with over **22.8 GWp** portfolio and **9.3 GWp** O&M across 28 countries.
- Global CEO **Chandra Kishore Thakur** says the contract underscores strong execution; gross inflows surpassed ₹2,400 crore this year.

items.title: Volkswagen to invest up to a billion euros in AI by end of decade
ISA seeks govt help to cut steel input costs
items.summary:
- ISA is engaging with the government to reduce *input costs*, aiming to make *iron ore more affordable* so steel prices come down, per Secretary General Alok Sahay at the New Delhi Steel Conclave.
- He said external costs beyond the plant affect India’s steel competitiveness and noted government actions on *anti-dumping measures*, safeguard duties, and transition financing.
- The ISA projects steel demand growth of about *7–8% annually* (around 150 mt this year) and reaffirmed India’s commitment to *net zero by 2070*, while tariffs with the US remain unchanged.

items.title: GST exemption for flight, motion simulators to help reduce training costs: Civil Aviation Ministry
Semiconductor equipment billings in Taiwan to double this year: SEMI
CN Water plans to foray into semiconductor-grade water
At 17, iPhone debuts at India’s largest factory
Japanese delegation explores semiconductors in Dholera
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- A 20-company Japanese delegation, including **Shimizu Corporation**, visited Dholera SIR to explore opportunities in India's semiconductor sector and discussed pairing Japan's precision tech with India's scale to position Dholera as a semiconductor hub.
- They explored collaborations for precision facilities serving **Tata Semiconductor** and other fabs, plus warehouses, gas distribution, clean rooms, and joint skill development for semiconductor manufacturing.
- Dholera hosts India's largest fab (Tata Group–PSMC) worth ₹92,000 crore, slated to start production in 2027, with other Activation Zone projects and a 5 GW solar park expected to generate 1.5 lakh+ jobs by 2030; improved expressway and airport boost connectivity.

items.title: India to be a manufacturing powerhouse via R&D
items.summary:
- India's manufacturing sector must move beyond short-term disruptions by embracing *agility*, *innovation*, and *global partnerships*, per the VLFM convention in Mumbai.
- Leaders warn that *sustainability*, *technology*, and *AI* are permanent priorities, urging R&D spending to rise from 0.3% of GDP toward the global average of about *1.5%*.
- The India–Japan collaboration is a major opportunity, pairing *India's digital strength* with *Japan's manufacturing expertise* to build a resilient, high-value manufacturing ecosystem.

items.title: LNJ Bhilwara acquires Statkraft stake in hydropower projects
TCS partners with CEA to advance physical AI in France
